intro: Randia aciculiflora, commonly known as the needle-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
